full_summary:
# Power House Structural Stabilization Project (Sault Ste. Marie Canal National Historic Site)

## Contract Details
- **Reference Number (Numéro de réference)**: PW-23-01028758
- **Solicitation Number (Numéro de sollicitation)**: 5P468-23-0013/A
- **Tender Closing Date (Date limite de soumission)**: 2023-03-16T14:00:00
- **Tender Status (Statut de l’appel d’offres)**: Expired

## Contract Description
Parks Canada seeks a Prime General Contractor with Heavy Construction experience to construct a passive ground water management system at the Power House, a Cultural Resource of National Significance, located at the City of Sault Ste Marie, Ontario, and the Sault Ste. Marie Canal National Historic Site of Canada. The project involves the removal, construction, and installation of several components, including a new contemporary valve chamber, two historic valves, a stainless Y-pipe system, and new concrete works.

## Tender Requirements
- Bidders must submit their proposal in two phases: Phase One (qualification) and Phase Two (financial evaluation).
- All notifications and communications must be in writing.
- Only the following methods of submission are accepted: fax, email, or in-person.
- Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted.

## Bidder Information
- Bidders must have a minimum of 5 business days to submit their response to the Contracting Authority's questions.
- All queries of a technical and contractual nature must be directed to the Contracting Officer.
- National Parks Regulations require all work to be in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

## Request for Proposal (Demande de proposition)
If you are a qualified contractor with experience in heavy construction, please submit your proposal according to the instructions. You can obtain the bid documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service on the Government of Canada's website: www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders.

## Languages of Communication
Parks Canada is committed to providing equivalent documents in both official languages. If you notice any discrepancies between the English and French versions, please inform the Contracting Officer as soon as possible.
